TopicTitle: Science gather should have impact on mission

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone!

last days I was surfing the web and read some articles about space exploration and I was start to think about KSP..

The humanity does not know a lot about the solar system but in KSP we know every detail about all planet from the map!

take for example venus exploration, during the course of time our scientific progress let us discover more detail:

the first Venera flyby only photographed an almost featurless space ball in visible light, then UV photo came out, there was then probes that were crushed from atmospheric pressure and temperature, the radar mapping to discover topology and so on...

wouldn't be cool if other planets in ksp need to be investigated by trial and errors, probes and flyby, photo and sample collection to obtain more and more information about them? and have every space object detailed by apposite gui in space center to, for example.. project an aerobrake with the pressure/altitude diagram?

Keeping Venus as example (because of the peculiar atmosphere that prevent soil photography in visible light), from land direct observation we can guess it's size, orbit and not much more.

what if we can do the same with Eve?

For example built up a series of probes to figure out temperature, atmospheric composition, radar mapping, try to land and obtain soil readings and analisys, maybe some noise and interference from the thin magnetosphere in report transmission back to home, try to deal with the excessive temperature and pression (maybe by configuring FAR and deadly reentry appropiately) where the excessive heat would damage instrumentation or in the case of Eeloo the cold will discharge faster the batteries..

this sound pretty cool to me, someone else agree?

I'm with u man. I totally agree on everything u said.

Not only probe will become useful, but this will become a jurney to explore the space instead of make a pic nic on every planet that already know from the start

Edited May 7, 2014 by Keymaster89
Last I heard about this (but this is very old and possibly no longer correct information) planet discovery is a planned feature

before posting I've took few minutes to check the "do not suggest" list and haven't see a line about that

well if this will come out in .25 or in a mod in both case should be awesome!

the closer we are to simulate this is to use FAR and deadly reentry but planetary info are fixed in game..

and the only way to visually simulate , for example, the eve/venus atmosphere is to mod the volumetric cloud addon like they did for duna sandstorm! what if the sandstorms could affect sensor range analisys and tamper trasmission?
